## respR publication


`respR` has been peer reviewed and published. Please cite this paper if you use it in your work:  
&nbsp;  


Harianto, J., Carey, N., & Byrne, M. respR - An R Package for the Manipulation and Analysis of Respirometry Data. *Methods in Ecology and Evolution*, 10(6), 912–920. [doi: 10.1111/2041-210X.13162](https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.13162).

## See also

These packages may also help you analyse respirometry data:

- [FishResp](https://fishresp.org) - Sergey Morozov
- [respirometry](https://cran.r-project.org/package=respirometry) - Matthew A. Birk
- [rMR](https://cran.r-project.org/package=rMR) - Tyler L. Moulton
- [LoLinR](https://github.com/colin-olito/LoLinR) - Colin Olito and Diego Barneche
- [segmented](https://cran.r-project.org/package=segmented) - Vito M. R. Muggeo

Also be sure to check out the [FishResp](https://fishresp.org) site, where the developers are releasing a variety of amazing free and open source tools for conducting respirometry experiments, including resources for building systems at a fraction of the cost of commercial systems.
